channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 纽约地铁的乘客们已经见怪不怪了。@Rosemarie_Ward 告诉 "The Intelligence "为什么他们现在看到地铁站里站满了国民警卫队士兵
item.description:
Riders of New York City’s subway have seen it all. @Rosemarie_Ward tells “The Intelligence” why they are now seeing stations lined with National Guard troops https://t.co/8ljdqbjSYD pic.twitter.com/AOPMD5QsO7

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 弗拉基米尔-普京入侵乌克兰正在改变远东城市符拉迪沃斯托克。通过我们的互动报道，探索这个战时俄罗斯的缩影👇。
item.description:
Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine is transforming the far eastern city of Vladivostok. Explore this microcosm of wartime Russia with our interactive report https://t.co/bZy4euSOyT 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 两千多年后，纽约市外的极端东正教犹太妇女也在进行类似的罢工--原因另当别论 👇。
item.description:
In the play “Lysistrata”, the women of warring Greek states deny their lovers sex in protest against an ongoing war.

More than two millennia later ultra-­Orthodox Jewish women outside New York City are carrying out a similar strike—for another reason https://t.co/nzrRFyPtE2 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 投资者为何将资金投入基础设施资产？本周的 "Money Talks "播客将为您揭晓答案： 🎧
item.description:
Why are investors pouring money into infrastructure assets? Find out on this week’s “Money Talks” podcast: https://t.co/J8dMQ2fPlT 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 在肯尼亚的一个角落，几乎每个人都参加了随机对照试验。有传言说，实验派发的现金会受到诅咒👇。
item.description:
In one corner of Kenya, virtually everyone has taken part in a randomised controlled trial. Rumours have spread that cash handouts from experiments are cursed https://t.co/7DFpDsKkSs 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 习近平认为，中国比美国等国家更民主。在我们的 "鼓楼 "播客中，@aliceysu 和 @jarmiles 对这一说法背后的意识形态体操进行了解读，并问道：中国公众相信吗？ 🎧
item.description:
Xi Jinping argues that China is more democratic than countries like America. On our “Drum Tower” podcast, @aliceysu and @jarmiles get their heads around the ideological gymnastics behind that claim, and ask: does the Chinese public believe it? https://t.co/IOA1nnU7PF 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 美国的精英大学臃肿、自满、不自由。为了保持竞争优势，常春藤联盟必须改变⬇️。
item.description:
America’s elite universities are bloated, complacent and illiberal.

To keep its competitive edge the Ivy League will have to change ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 克里斯蒂娜-布拉西-福特（Christine Blasey Ford）重新成为聚光灯下的焦点。阅读大法官布雷特-卡瓦诺的指控者如何通过回忆录回归 👇
item.description:
Christine Blasey Ford is re-entering the spotlight. Read how Justice Brett Kavanaugh’s accuser has returned with a memoir https://t.co/Xf2JDa1p10 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: "从长远来看，这只会真正损害香港"。在 "情报 "节目中@billridgers 探讨了一项新的国家安全法，这一次，它不会再遭到抗议。收听播客： 🎧
item.description:
“In the long run this can only really harm Hong Kong.” On “The Intelligence” @billridgers examines a new national-security law that, this time, will not be met with protests. Listen to the podcast: https://t.co/4GJRFs5ngh 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）在亚利桑那州的目的是支持该州日益壮大的拉丁裔选民。虽然这个群体在 2020 年帮助总统赢得了该州的选举，但我们的图表显示，为什么他不应该认为他们会在今年的选举中发挥同样的作用 👇
item.description:
Joe Biden is in Arizona aiming to shore up the state’s growing Latino electorate. Although this group helped the president clinch the state in 2020, our charts show why he shouldn’t assume they will play the same role in this year’s election https://t.co/7gU0giv0mc 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 11 月，美国人将选出他们的下一任总统。经济学人》正在追踪这场角逐。关注最新民调，阅读关于两位主要候选人的简短指南，并标记关键的选举日历日期👇。
item.description:
In November Americans will elect their next president. The Economist is tracking the contest. Follow the latest polls, read short guides on the two main candidates, and mark key electoral-calendar dates https://t.co/me9EWFWhtw 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 关于外国出生的人在英国的居住地以及居住模式如何变化的研究太少。但对少数民族群体的研究却很多，而且结果令人震惊 👇。
item.description:
Too little research has been done on where foreign-born people live in Britain and how the pattern is changing. But much work has been done on ethnic-minority groups, and the results are striking https://t.co/bBD1ynjXxL 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 今天的 "情报 "节目：香港令人担忧的模糊新法、纽约地铁上的士兵以及耳鸣如何剥夺患者的安静。收听每日播客： 👇
item.description:
Today on “The Intelligence”: Hong Kong’s worryingly ambiguous new law, the soldiers on New York’s subways and how tinnitus robs its sufferers of silence. Listen to the daily podcast: https://t.co/CsmRXrrgZT 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰和俄罗斯通过攻击电信、关键基础设施、军用计算机以及他们能入侵的任何其他设备，进行着窃取情报和制造恐慌的战斗。
item.description:
Ukraine and Russia are locked in combat to steal intelligence and sow panic by attacking telecommunications, critical infrastructure, military computers and whatever else they can hack into.

So far no one is winning the cyberwar https://t.co/woQrnezY6g 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: "古查兰-达斯（Gurcharan Das）写道："印度不得不等到 1991 年的自由化才赢得了经济自由。"印度成为世界上增长速度第二快的大型经济体。"但就在一切似乎进展顺利的时候，民主却开始削弱。
item.description:
“India had to wait until the liberalisation of 1991 to win its economic freedom,” writes Gurcharan Das.

It became the world’s second-fastest-growing large economy. “But just when everything seemed to be going well, democracy began to weaken” https://t.co/87mpyk9IuD

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 哈维尔-米莱正试图将阿根廷引向一条危险的狭窄道路。在经历了 100 天的残酷考验后，他对市场充满信心。阿根廷人也没有放弃他👇。
item.description:
Javier Milei is trying to steer Argentina down a dangerously narrow path. After 100 brutal days, he has markets believing. Argentines have not given up on him either https://t.co/Y9UFsbNM3S 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 人力资源部门的 Barry 真的让你忍无可忍，需要发泄一下吗？工作中发脾气的利与弊 👇
item.description:
Has Barry from HR really been pushing your buttons and you need to vent? These are the pros and cons of losing your temper at work https://t.co/I5BqjsCBtn 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 西方必须认识到将其非洲政策外包给不认同其价值观的国家的危险；非洲国家也应了解让自己成为别人地缘政治游戏中的棋子的风险👇。
item.description:
The West must see the danger of outsourcing its Africa policies to countries that do not share its values; and African countries should know the risks of letting themselves be used as pawns in someone else’s geopolitical games https://t.co/k0QHNdKP4s 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 中国、俄罗斯和伊朗之间正在形成一个反西方轴心。在西方的封锁下，该联盟使其初级成员免于崩溃。但要成为真正的伙伴关系，它仍面临重重障碍 👇。
item.description:
An anti-Western axis is forming between China, Russia and Iran. The alliance has saved its junior members from collapse amid Western embargoes. But it still faces obstacles to becoming a true partnership https://t.co/g8c0KHUGMt 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 近 50 年来，美国一直鼓励大型汽车销售的一个漏洞很快将被收紧。我们将解释为什么这可能不足以鼓励美国人购买小型汽车。
item.description:
A loophole that for nearly 50 years has incentivised sales of big vehicles in America will soon be tightened. We explain why that may not be enough to encourage Americans to buy smaller cars, however https://t.co/UbrvAW1lJK 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 2022 年，法国男女是欧洲身材最苗条的国家，只有 10% 的人被认为肥胖。查看地图，了解其他地区的肥胖率
item.description:
French women and men were the most slender in Europe in 2022—only 10% were considered obese. Explore our map to see the obesity rates in other regions https://t.co/lfWqeBCBfK

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 多发性硬化症会很快成为过去吗？接吻病毒 "疫苗点燃希望 👇
item.description:
Could multiple sclerosis soon be a thing of the past? A vaccine for the “kissing virus” is igniting hope https://t.co/il3YRugTu1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 我们的记者挑选了五本预示着当今重大事件的书籍。这些书都是十多年前出版的，它们提供了预示和教训👇。
item.description:
Our journalists have picked five books that foreshadow the big stories of the present. All published more than a decade ago, they offer portents and lessons https://t.co/sBTy5CD5Xz 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 世界上哪个国家最民主？了解最新民主指数 👇
item.description:
Which is the most democratic country in the world? Explore the latest democracy index https://t.co/lDB605xvtO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 经济学人》希望了解 2024 年的符拉迪沃斯托克。因此，我们花了大量时间分析公开信息、计算数字并与居民交谈。请跟随我们的脚步，从人到地方，了解这座城市的构成： 👇
item.description:
The Economist wanted to get to know the Vladivostok of 2024. So we spent time analysing open-source information, crunching numbers and speaking to residents.

Follow the journey we took to find out what makes the city, from its people to its places: https://t.co/XfZxTLW81B 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: "美国人不觉得到处都是彩虹。这是一个非常非常黑暗的消费前景。"@chowardchoward 在 "制衡 "节目中认为，选民不为强劲的经济感到高兴是 "奇怪的" 🎧
item.description:
“Americans don't feel like there are rainbows everywhere. It's a very, very dark consumer outlook.” @chowardchoward thinks it’s “weird” that voters aren’t happier about the strong economy, on “Checks and Balance” https://t.co/EkvRDMuDBJ 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 市场正在飙升。但这并不意味着匆忙买入股票就是明智之举。接下来发生的事情不太可能让投资者满心欢喜👇。
item.description:
Markets are soaring. But that does not make it wise to rush out and buy stocks. What happens next is unlikely to fill investors with glee https://t.co/gIA9wxtLQX 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 美国的拉丁裔选民增长异常迅速。这应该有助于民主党人--但唐纳德-特朗普的支持率正在上升👇。
item.description:
America’s Latino electorate is growing unusually fast. That should help Democrats—but Donald Trump is gaining ground https://t.co/Uke7L9vKCO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 一则个人新闻：我将重返《经济学人》，负责德国的报道。从一个月左右开始，我将在伦敦和柏林两地工作，但会花很多时间在柏林。
item.description:
🔊Spot of personal news: I am returning to head @TheEconomist's coverage of Germany. I will be dividing my time between London and Berlin but spending a lot of time in the Hauptstadt, starting in a month or so.

— Tom Nuttall (@tom_nuttall) March 20, 2024

item.title: 🚨非常高兴地告诉大家，我现在是 @TheEconomist 的社交媒体主管！这是我梦寐以求的工作--我还在为自己捏一把汗。非常期待看到我们这个出色的团队未来的发展🌟。
item.description:
🚨Very happy to share that I am now Head of Social Media at @TheEconomist! This is my dream job - I’m still pinching myself. Very excited to see what the future holds for our fantastic team 🌟

— Isobel Owen (@IsobelMOwen) March 20, 2024
